summary: This document is an email chain from October 2020 regarding logistical arrangements for a DOJ-organized meeting in Miami for Epstein victims. The correspondence is between an unnamed DOJ representative and Diane Aldrich, the executive assistant to attorney Gloria Allred, concerning RSVPs, travel, and security for Allred's clients to attend the meeting.

persons.name: Diane Aldrich
persons.context: The primary point of contact in the email chain, coordinating logistics for attorney Gloria Allred's clients to attend a DOJ meeting for Epstein victims in Miami.

persons.name: Gloria Allred
persons.context: A prominent attorney whose clients (Epstein victims) are being invited to a DOJ meeting in Miami; her office is handling the coordination.

connections.description: Diane Aldrich is identified as the Executive Assistant to attorney Gloria Allred, acting on her behalf to coordinate client logistics.
Gloria Allred represents clients who are Epstein victims, and she/her office is facilitating their attendance at a DOJ meeting.

events.title: DOJ Meeting for Epstein Victims in Miami
events.description: A meeting organized by the Department of Justice for Epstein victims, to be held in Miami, Florida. Logistics, RSVPs, and security clearances are being coordinated.

locations: 6300 Wilshire Boulevard, Suite 1500, Los Angeles, CA 90048
keyFacts: The Department of Justice was organizing a meeting for Epstein victims in Miami on November 12, 2020.
Attorney Gloria Allred's office, via her executive assistant Diane Aldrich, was coordinating the attendance of Allred's clients at this meeting.
The DOJ required detailed personal information (including Social Security Number) for security clearance to access the meeting venue.
The email chain references a similar event that occurred the previous year, indicating ongoing DOJ engagement with victims.
The communication highlights the formal, confidential process for victim participation in post-Epstein legal proceedings.
